pullRequest.title: [CDAP-17288] Added Path rewrite for temporary Checkpoint file.
pullRequest.bodyText: Added class rewriting logic to add a timestamp to the temporary file used by Spark when creating a checkpoint.

nodes.bodyText: This should be an optional rewrite controlled by cdap-site.xml
No need to have final
Why need the full class name? It can be just String.class.
Same here. Can be just StringBuilder.class
Also, I would suggest check if the previous instruction was a LDC "temp". We don't want to rewrite if the second parameter is not the constant string "temp"
Use the checkpointTime field instead of System.currentTimeMillis.
For generating code, it's easier to use GeneratorAdapter instead of MethodVisitor directly.
no need to have final
Move this as a simple boolean field in the returned inner class.
It is dangerous to pass the mv to two different MethodVisitor (one to the adapter above, one here). It is better to just return a new GeneratorAdapter here.
The && should be on the next line. See https://www.oracle.com/java/technologies/javase/codeconventions-indentation.html#248
Should document how the source code looks like. The bytecode is already as part of the code down below, no need to repeat that.
You should reset it to false when the value is not "temp".
Since these constants are only used in the Spark runtime, I would suggest moving them to the SparkRuntimeUtils class.

nodes.bodyText: I would check the boolean first for a faster short circuit
typo: checkpoints
You are using the checkpoint time instead of the current timestamp, right?
You need to override the visitField  of the ClassWriter to make sure this class actually has this field. Otherwise you can result in cryptic classloading failure

This class shouldn't reference Spark or Hadoop classes via .class. See https://github.com/cdapio/cdap/blob/develop/cdap-spark-core-base/src/main/java/io/cdap/cdap/app/runtime/spark/classloader/SparkClassRewriter.java#L80
Only classes from the bootstrap classloader (i.e JRE classes) can be referenced with .class.
Remove extra empty line
Please update the comment. I think you are using checkpointTime.milliseconds(), right?
Remove empty line

nodes.bodyText: Why need two separate constants? Can we just have one? Also, since the constant is defined inside spark, it doesn't need to be so long. E.g. It can be just CHECKPOINT_REWRITE_ENABLED.

You shouldn't be override this. This get called when a field is used inside a method. What I suggested earlier is to override the ClassVisitor.visitField method to make the field is defined in the class.

beforeCommit.message: Added comments explaining configuration keys for the rewrite checkpoint temp file behavior.

afterCommit.message:


CDAP-17288 Added class rewriting logic to add a timestamp to the temporary file used by Spark when creating a checkpoint.

This prevents rate limit issues with streaming pipelines when using GCS for checkpoints.

Fixed typo with constructor.

Updated logic to use the Checkpoint Time as the unique identified for the temporary file.

Added generator adapter for convenience.

Updated structure to return a Generator Adapter.

Styling fixes.

Added configuration option `spark.streaming.checkpoint.rewrite.enabled` to control behavior of the Checkpoint temp file name rewriting behavior.

Added a log line once the class rewrite is complete.

Comment fixes.

Added logic to check if the Checkpoint Time field exists before attemptiing to rewrite the class.

Moved field visitor logic to the Class visitor.

Styling changes.

Added comments explaining configuration keys for the rewrite checkpoint temp file behavior.
